The actual quantum tests should be a patch."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-13 16:21:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: (1 inline comment)

Sean: I think the longevity of the change is confusing things.  

The modifications to manager.py are simply a cleanup of a change (that I authored back in august) that attempted to lay the groundwork for these quantum smoke tests, and no other code depends on that change but this one.  As I mention inline, though, I do intend to cleanup the way these tests authenticate (use an existing user rather than creating a new one) in a new patch.

As to the modifications to smoke.py, if you take a look at the history on this change you'll see that they were actually requested by Jay Pipes.  I'm happy to break it out into a separate patch, though again it was a cleanup on the immediate ancestor of this change authored back in august."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-14 02:34:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-14 02:37:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Sean: I've moved out-of-scope changes into separate changes, as requested.

Otherwise, the latest patch should be more in line with existing smoke tests in that it uses configured credentials rather than creating new tenants and users.  The supporting devstack test has been updated accordingly:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17776/"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-14 03:42:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Doesn't seem to work

At the suggestion of a colleague, the latest patch looks up the tenant id via keystone rather than relying on it to be configured'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-14 18:44:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-14 18:53:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: (3 inline comments)

I think the resources used by multiple test cases should be initialized by the setUpClass and deleted by the tearDownClass. Methods start with test_ should not depend on each other, and should not depend on the execution order.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-14 19:05:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

afazekas: These smoke tests are intended to depend on resources created by other tests.  That's why the tests are numbered - to ensure stable execution order.

Fair point on keypairs and security groups not having to to created at test-time, though - I used the compute smoke tests as a template but there is no good reason for doing that here.  I'll move that to setupClass as you suggest."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-14 19:16:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

https://nose.readthedocs.org/en/latest/doc_tests/test_multiprocess/multiprocess.html

I heard about several attempts to make tempest faster, many of them don't care about naming."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-14 19:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

afazekas: Tests such as the one in this change necessarily depend on the artifacts of previous tests are not amenable to running concurrently.  They need to run synchronously, one after the other, in a defined order.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-14 19:38:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

I can't recall a test case ever rejected simply because it is too big.

001..004 can be in the setUpClass.

005 can be one test.
006-007 can be merge as one test."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-14 19:55:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Works for me

Build successful

'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-12-14 22:33:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Maru, thanks for adding these tests.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-14 23:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: No score

Starting gate jobs.
https://jenkins.openstack.org/zuul/status'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-12-14 23:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Attila, this is subclassed from tempest.smoke.SmokeTest, not the regular BaseComputeTest. Please see the smoke tests in /tempest/tests/compute/servers/test_basic_server_ops.py for the example where this is copied from and discussion of why smoke tests in this pattern use the test_00X_xxx numbered test methods and successive test methods depending on fixtures created in previous test methods.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-15 00:13:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Verified

Build successful

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-06 03:24:36.000000000', 'message': 'Add smoke tests for quantum.

 * Added test_network_basic_ops, a port of the devstack exercise
   script quantum-adv-test.sh.
 * Testing of network connectivity is incomplete pending a decision
   as to what environment the smoke tests should (or can expect) to
   require.

commit_message:
Add smoke tests for quantum.

 * Added test_network_basic_ops, a port of the devstack exercise
   script quantum-adv-test.sh.
 * Tenant network connectivity can be tested by setting
   the 'tenant_networks_reachable' key in tempest.conf to 'true'.
 * Public (floating ip) connectivity can be tested by setting the
   'public_network_id' key in tempest.conf.
 * Addresses bug 1043980

Change-Id: I506518c431a8da0b91e3044f2a6aabce48081d93

This is awesome. +200 lines of tests, -100 lines of code, yay!'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-12-08 15:37:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

Hey Mark,

I tried running this in SmokeStack w/ a swift multitenant config and got the following error:

2012-12-08 10:12:57 12784 CRITICAL glance [-] Store swift could not be configured correctly. Reason: Multi-tenant Swift storage requires a context.
2012-12-08 10:12:57 12784 TRACE glance Traceback (most recent call last):
2012-12-08 10:12:57 12784 TRACE glance   File "/usr/bin/glance-api", line 56, in <module>
2012-12-08 10:12:57 12784 TRACE glance     glance.store.create_stores()
2012-12-08 10:12:57 12784 TRACE glance   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/glance/store/__init__.py", line 152, in create_stores
2012-12-08 10:12:57 12784 TRACE glance     store_instance = store_cls()
2012-12-08 10:12:57 12784 TRACE glance   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/glance/store/swift.py", line 208, in Store
2012-12-08 10:12:57 12784 TRACE glance     return MultiTenantStore(*args, **kwargs)
2012-12-08 10:12:57 12784 TRACE glance   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/glance/store/base.py", line 38, in __init__
2012-12-08 10:12:57 12784 TRACE glance     self.configure()
2012-12-08 10:12:57 12784 TRACE glance   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/glance/store/swift.py", line 525, in configure
2012-12-08 10:12:57 12784 TRACE glance     reason=reason)
2012-12-08 10:12:57 12784 TRACE glance BadStoreConfiguration: Store swift could not be configured correctly. Reason: Multi-tenant Swift storage requires a context.

----'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-12-08 19:47:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

Thanks for checking on this one, Dan!

I suppose I missed that when stores are initially created, they don't get passed contexts. I'll see what I can do to fix this up."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-12-08 21:29:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-12-08 21:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

Dan,

I moved the context check back into configure_add, where it was before this patch. That seems to have cleared up the issue. I tested this out with swift and multitenant on in devstack and was able to startup, list, download, and add images successfully.

Thanks for catching the critical test path I missed!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-08 21:53:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/17652/3/check/gate-glance-merge/3019 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/17652/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/21502 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-12-10 18:41:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Thanks Mark:

One question for you on the new changes: It looks like the new code no longer supports the upgrade path were a user enables multi_tenant but has existing single tenant images still in use.

Previously if an image URL (location) had a user it would try to access it via the Swift credentials stored in the database. Should we still support this mechanism as an upgrade path?"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-12-10 18:55:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yes, we should support that upgrade path. I'll look into it."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-12-13 00:24:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-12-13 00:28:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Refactor multi-tenant swift store.

This patch attempts to provide a separation between the multi-tenant and
single-tenant use cases of glance.store.swift

Change-Id: I317855bc84c96f5541db1ffd86dc151a4a15a123

subject: Add admin credential config for network client.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 97, 'name': 'Daryl Walleck', 'email': 'daryl.walleck@rackspace.com', 'username': 'dwalleck'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 2035, 'name': 'Maru Newby', 'email': 'marun@redhat.com', 'username': 'maru'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-14 03:24:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18105/1/check/gate-tempest-merge/1262 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18105/1/check/gate-tempest-pep8/1216 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18105/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/22296 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-14 17:16:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Do you think in tempest practice the identity and the compute admin will be different from the network admin ?

If you replace the network client creation, to admin client creation, how do you plan to test the network as regular user?
IMHO we should make sure non admin users, can't do admin stuff. 

IMHO in the future, we should try to use only single admin account in the config  and create other accounts (user, tenant, role,..)  when needed. We should use 'tempest'-<resource_type>-<resource-name> format.

For now:
Is it possible
to have both admin and regular user client based on the compute and compute-admin credentials ?
Probably the tempest/tests/network/base.py could provide, both and the test cases could pick the right one."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-14 17:39:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

afazekas: With all due respect, I don't think this is the place for long-form discussion on how and why tempest is configured.  I've been working on getting some quantum smoke tests into the codebase for some time now, and this change was broken out at the request of another reviewer (Sean Dague) because he considered it orthogonal.  If there needs to be a change to the way tempest is configured (and frankly I would agree that is the case), I suggest that the best place to have that discussion is on the mailing list, and that the result of such a discussion would be a sweeping change to how all the smoke tests are configured, not just the network client.

As to your question of quantum authorization, of course there will be a need to test tenant-authorized access to the service.  The initial tests are targeted specifically at replicating the existing devstack exercise script for quantum (as should be clear from the bug linked to in the commit message), and the intent of that script is to check that a vm can be booted with quantum-configured networking and have connectivity.  More comprehensive tests will follow, and the configuration will evolve to support that.  For now, though, the scope of this change is intentionally limited to support what is being implemented, rather than presuming what future efforts will require."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-14 18:11:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-14 18:23:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I would like note it will require changes in devstack in order to set the password correctly.
https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/lib/tempest#L206'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-14 18:34:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

afazekas: Please review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17776/'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-14 18:44:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-14 19:04:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I don't want to block the dependent patches, but I think we will need  a not admin client too."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-14 19:56:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18105/3/check/gate-tempest-merge/1285 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/18105/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/22393 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-12-14 22:23:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Yes, all good.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-14 22:24:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

https://jenkins.openstack.org/zuul/status'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-14 23:32:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-14 19:03:28.000000000', 'message': "RestClient: Don't hard code volume service name.

Updates the common/rest_client keystone_auth function so that
it doesn't hard code the 'service_name' for the volume service.

The motivation here is to allow Tempest to run in more environments
where the volume service name may not always be 'cinder'.

Change-Id: I3b892781929642fd42a3dd3b4ba8d44486bfe275
"}]
commit_message:
RestClient: Don't hard code volume service name.

Updates the common/rest_client keystone_auth function so that
it doesn't hard code the 'service_name' for the volume service.

The motivation here is to allow Tempest to run in more environments
where the volume service name may not always be 'cinder'.

Change-Id: I3b892781929642fd42a3dd3b4ba8d44486bfe275

commit_message:
document correct config in dispersion-report help

The --help message of swift-dispersion-report used to say
/etc/swift/stats.conf instead of the correct and consistent
/etc/swift/dispersion.conf - this change updates that
commandline help message.

Change-Id: I69ad64d31bb86eb0d36fcf5b17aa8bf42f646ed1

(Newer) WebOb returns different different objects in Request._body_file__get,

Content-Length header is set. Otherwise it returns a io.BufferedReader.

    https://github.com/Pylons/webob/blob/master/webob/request.py#L264 vs

commit_message:
Use io.BufferedIOBase.read() instead of io.BytesIO.getvalue().

(Newer) WebOb returns different different objects in Request._body_file__get,
i.e. a io.BytesIO if either the HTTP method is PUT or POST or a
Content-Length header is set. Otherwise it returns a io.BufferedReader.

    https://github.com/Pylons/webob/blob/master/webob/request.py#L264 vs
    https://github.com/Pylons/webob/blob/master/webob/request.py#L278

Unfortunately, both Objects have different sets of methods, i.e. only
io.Bytes has getvalue(). However, both objects inherit from
io.BufferedIOBase, thus read() is available on both.

Change-Id: I4a99fef0e6acbf67d9e86ff884f48f5a1cb1bc78

[{'created': '2012-12-13 22:40:10.000000000', 'message': "ensure servers are deleted between tests

Possible fix for bug #1079687

When running tests we create a lot of servers, and do delete
calls at the end of tests. However delete is an async action,
so the previous servers will often be hanging around after our
tests. In memory constrained environments like the OpenStack CI
system if deletes happen too slowly we hit the memory limits,
nova scheduler can no longer schedule VMs, and the tests get flakey.

This *may* fix the periodic fails we've seen on tempest in nova.

Pair programmed with Matt Treinish <treinish@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I1f93ac26064c68bf529e2efa1bf0c35e1f4e7d2c

commit_message:
ensure servers are deleted between tests

Possible fix for bug #1079687

When running tests we create a lot of servers, and do delete
calls at the end of tests. However delete is an async action,
so the previous servers will often be hanging around after our
tests. In memory constrained environments like the OpenStack CI
system if deletes happen too slowly we hit the memory limits,
nova scheduler can no longer schedule VMs, and the tests get flakey.

This *may* fix the periodic fails we've seen on tempest in nova.

Pair programmed with Matt Treinish <treinish@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I1f93ac26064c68bf529e2efa1bf0c35e1f4e7d2c

commit_message:
Fixes KeyError: 'sr_uuid' when booting from volume on xenapi

This change fixes the capability for a XenServer/XCP hypervisor
to boot instances from an iscsi volume running on Cinder.

This patch takes into account that Cinder can be configured
with an iscsi back-end, instead of a xensm one, where keys like
sr_uuid are not being specified. It works through the magic of
determining the SR, and the vdi associated with the iscsi target
and lun.

This patch also does a bit of clean-up of code/comments that no
longer apply.

Addresses bug #1087308

Change-Id: Ie7d65eeb965b3468e4407981788725e2b43bff5e

commit_message:
add create_server_with_extras

most of the servers tests weren't using the create_server
utility method, which meant no automatic server tracking and
class level cleanup.

Most of these tests used the underlying create_server with
additional keyword args, and expected access to the resp in
the return, so a new method was needed for easiest transition.

create_server_with_extras shouldn't run synchronously because
we need to test states of servers besides ACTIVE

Pair programmed with Matt Treinish <treinish@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I736ea755a512723eb6b9bae57e2112985c46ea45

commit_message:
install.sh add logic detecting rabbitmq

Detect rabbitmq (On Ubuntu and Fedora), and sed the config files
with appropriate values if it looks like we're installing on a
system with rabbitmq and not the default qpidd

fixes bug 1090420

Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I04a40aab00e7e13d245900aeb384d769d57c4012

commit_message:
modify ca-certificate default value

modify the value from env[OS_CA_CERT] to env[OS_CACERT] to ensure the help message and codes keep consistent.

Fixes: bug 1086278

Change-Id: I0a502069cd3743f812c8145cbce73cd091e57de6

encryption key - this will allow rabbitmq detection to only be done in
one place

ref bug 1090420

commit_message:
install.sh simplify heat-engine.conf conditional

Minor tweak to the conditional detecting heat-engine.conf to sed in the
encryption key - this will allow rabbitmq detection to only be done in
one place

ref bug 1090420

Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I9031218796a52efd350c39167ecb112048dad218

commit_message:
Allow xenapi to work with empty image metadata

Also, add a number of tests for unit coverage
of the boot from volume feature.

Fixes bug #1087869

Change-Id: I7160e8c3b3d0ecd55a0ee0a66c512595bc25fb43

Sam, my apologies for my ignorance in your earlier patchsets. I've looked over the cinder.image.glance more closely and it appears it's already hardcoded here:

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/image/glance.py#L58

Your placement for setting default version=1 is more correct than the current code. However, I believe the current state is working fine because everything in GlanceClientWrapper eventually calls _create_glance_client() which will default to version=1. My guess for the difference in nova doing this is in __init__ of the GlanceClientWrapper is because they're not defaulting in the same place as us. Since the current state is fine, I'm ok with your change as it is and we don't need you to fix my mistake in decision there to delay your merge. :) Hopefully oslo will fix this mess for us in the future or we start checking from a configurable area like flag/conf."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-14 15:42:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

commit_message:
Support glance servers over https

Fixes bug 1089147

Updated glance.py from nova's version to support glance over ssl
eg. glance_api_servers=https://glance.mydomain:9292

New Flag: glance_api_insecure
Set to True to disable certificate checking

Change-Id: I53e62900265fea2de9b0ec20bbff0c40f1b14c91

[{'created': '2012-12-13 20:16:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix use of osapi_compute_extension option in api_samples.

Change: I682fa491dd1435814b73404d91df3387504c3e39 changed the
scope of the osapi_compute_extension but didn't update it's use
in test_api_samples.py. This prevents the tests from being run
individually because the option is no longer in nova.config.

The CONF.import() for osapi_compute_extension now refers to the
proper location: nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib

Change-Id: I5d0f15c41e2d6e118a075872e706e91d6555dd39
"}, {'created': '2012-12-13 20:34:09.000000000', 'message': "Fix use of osapi_compute_extension option in api_samples.

Change: I682fa491dd1435814b73404d91df3387504c3e39 changed the
scope of the osapi_compute_extension but didn't update it's use
in test_api_samples.py. This prevents the tests from being run
individually because the option is no longer in nova.config.

The CONF.import() for osapi_compute_extension now refers to the
proper location: nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib

Change-Id: I5d0f15c41e2d6e118a075872e706e91d6555dd39
"}]
commit_message:
Fix use of osapi_compute_extension option in api_samples.

Change: I682fa491dd1435814b73404d91df3387504c3e39 changed the
scope of the osapi_compute_extension but didn't update it's use
in test_api_samples.py. This prevents the tests from being run
individually because the option is no longer in nova.config.

The CONF.import() for osapi_compute_extension now refers to the
proper location: nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib

Change-Id: I5d0f15c41e2d6e118a075872e706e91d6555dd39

commit_message:
Fix errors in used_limits extension

Fixes bug #1062049

There was a typo mapping the security groups resource to floating IPs.

Volumes usage isn't tracked by Nova any more since delete-nova-volume.

Key pairs don't work with the extension because of bug #1089877.

Change-Id: Ifd694b21fef1dc95e67c07dcef0cd6ea3daa8d53

[{'created': '2012-12-14 11:23:47.000000000', 'message': "dhcp.filters needs ovs_vsctl permission

The dhcp agent calls ovs_vsctl so it will fail if using rootwrap
and these aren't specified. The reason why this was working using
rootwrap before is because there are other filters in
etc/quantum/rootwrap.d that specifiy ovs_vsctl which
allows the agent to make those calls. Fixes bug 1090072

Change-Id: I509c191c97e7187361a09788e841ebb5a9f934c7
"}]
commit_message:
dhcp.filters needs ovs_vsctl permission

The dhcp agent calls ovs_vsctl so it will fail if using rootwrap
and these aren't specified. The reason why this was working using
rootwrap before is because there are other filters in
etc/quantum/rootwrap.d that specifiy ovs_vsctl which
allows the agent to make those calls. Fixes bug 1090072

Change-Id: I509c191c97e7187361a09788e841ebb5a9f934c7

ceilometer, so users can easily choose and set up sql db environment
for ceilometer with 'stack.sh' by explicitly specifying the following
statement in localrc:

commit_message:
Add sql db option to devstack for ceilometer

Ceilometer uses mongodb as the default storage.
This is one of the patches to support sql db option in devstack for
ceilometer, so users can easily choose and set up sql db environment
for ceilometer with 'stack.sh' by explicitly specifying the following
statement in localrc:

    use_database mysql

where mysql is taken as an example.

If users remove the above statement, mongodb is used and set up
by default.

Change-Id: Id246a66413572f277029dad09edf8396e3547498
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Raise NotImplemented for drivers that don't support images

Fixes bug #1090169

Raise NotImplementedError on copy_image_to_volume and
copy_volume_to_image on drivers that inherit from
driver.ISCSIDriver that don't support this feature yet.

Change-Id: I516d424a75dd21260f2ccc68467a8f6e6ac08e4d

commit_message:
Copy both http and https proxy to local-config.

Previously, only http_proxy was copied into the local-config image.
We now preserve both http_proxy and https_proxy settings.

Change-Id: I4de2712f2772fb7d07b228cecdc0c8ec6f3df567
Co-authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

method to work with parallel test runs. In the process, ensure that it's
dead simple to add a similar check for any test covering an API.

commit_message:
Add general mechanism for testing api coverage.

Refactor the VirtAPI test that ensures all api methods have a test
method to work with parallel test runs. In the process, ensure that it's
dead simple to add a similar check for any test covering an API.

Change-Id: Ie5849a28aa4bfb8f5882ef57344e4131317d2e96

commit_message:
Fixed the unit tests using SQLite do not check foreign keys.

The foreign key constraints will be enabled for each SQLite
database connection.

By default the foreign key constraints are disabled in SQLite,
so some test cases failed after enabling the foreign key
constraints for unit tests. This fixings also fixed the failed
test cases because of the foreign key enforcement.

Fixes: bug #1021023
Change-Id: I89f0cbbd75bb685b50dfe6628116fa971c5e78cb

(4 inline comments)

Thanks for increasing the coverage.  A minor nits to address."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-12-14 04:09:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

@zylou  You are sacrificing code readability on a misplaced concern.  assertTrue is significantly faster.  

The short explanation is that assertEqual goes a lot of extra steps to arrive at "if not first == second".  Where assertTrue jumps directly to "if not expr"

(see http://hg.python.org/cpython/file/6c8a7469670b/Lib/unittest/case.py)  

The forms themselves have speed differences too:

Here's the run times of the various forms:
$ python -m timeit "x = 1 if not True == True else 0"
10000000 loops, best of 3: 0.108 usec per loop
$ python -m timeit "x = 1 if not True is True else 0"
10000000 loops, best of 3: 0.0914 usec per loop
$ python -m timeit "x = 1 if not True  else 0"
10000000 loops, best of 3: 0.0546 usec per loop'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-12-14 04:09:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-12-14 04:09:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Thanks for your patience.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-14 04:09:29.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Fix for broken switch for config_drive

There's a wrong check in api.py, we should check if config_drive
is not a boolean string before we try to treat it as an image id

Fixes LP #1090148

Change-Id: I2e0bc49922781138e569471b0dd360fb3918b687

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-10 11:18:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix keystoneclient user-list output order

keystone user-list output is ordered by 'id' now.
But this order(by 'id') is not human-friendly. Sorting by 'name' is easy to
identify a user.

This patch fixes this problem.

Fixes bug 1073437

Change-Id: I00b1f46c248544157e09b2efccfff63a1f0426aa
"}, {'created': '2012-12-10 23:10:44.000000000', 'message': "Fix keystoneclient user-list output order

commit_message:
Fix keystoneclient user-list output order

keystone user-list output is ordered by 'id' now.
But this order(by 'id') is not human-friendly. Sorting by 'name' is easy to
identify a user.

This patch fixes this problem.

Fixes bug 1073437

Change-Id: I00b1f46c248544157e09b2efccfff63a1f0426aa

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-13 03:28:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix sleep in test_consoleauth.

test_consoleauth:ConsoleauthTestCase.test_tokens_expire called
time.sleep(1.1) in order to test that tokens with a TTL of 1 second
expire after one second. Problem is time.sleep() may return before the
entire sleep period is complete. Put sleep in a while loop and check the
elapsed time before checking token expiry to correct this problem.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: Iae0e678fb12a76757523dc7dbccb4da98cef85e6
'}, {'created': '2012-12-13 18:19:19.000000000', 'message': "Remove sleep in test_consoleauth.

test_consoleauth:ConsoleauthTestCase.test_tokens_expire called
time.sleep(1.1) in order to test that tokens with a TTL of 1 second
expire after one second. Problem is time.sleep() may return before the
entire sleep period is complete. Remove the sleep and instead use Oslo's
timeutils to override the time and advance it by one second to check
that expired tokens do expire.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: Iae0e678fb12a76757523dc7dbccb4da98cef85e6
"}]
commit_message:
Remove sleep in test_consoleauth.

test_consoleauth:ConsoleauthTestCase.test_tokens_expire called
time.sleep(1.1) in order to test that tokens with a TTL of 1 second
expire after one second. Problem is time.sleep() may return before the
entire sleep period is complete. Remove the sleep and instead use Oslo's
timeutils to override the time and advance it by one second to check
that expired tokens do expire.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: Iae0e678fb12a76757523dc7dbccb4da98cef85e6

Related Change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17666/'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-13 22:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It is not clear for me:
If there is stable devstack version, why it does not use a stable devstack-gate version ?'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-12-13 22:04:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Almost all of devstack-gate is used outside of the context of openstack branches.  Most of it is about creating images, spinning up nodes, preparing them, deleting them, etc.  There's one file where all of the openstack-branch divergence is localized, that's devstack-gate-vm.sh, and so far, it's been handled with conditionals.  I think it's still pretty readable.  I'm open to something else, however.  We could do branches, but then only the master branch would be used for node management, the other branches would just have some dead code in them.  we'd also need to handle the fact that every devstack-gate run would start with the devstack-gate script in master, and then at some point the devstack-gate repo itself would need to change to a stable/ branch while it's running...  

An alternative would be to just have multiple copies of devstack-gate-vm.sh in the master branch, So devstack-gate-vm-wrap.sh calls 'stable/diablo/devstack-gate-vm.sh'.

Anyway, this looks like a good way to handle it, thanks!"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-12-13 22:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-11 19:03:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix poll_rescued_instances periodic task

The poll_rescued_instances periodic task now checks the amount of time
that an instance has been in the RESCUED stated before timing out the
resue.  It also now performs the unrescue through the compute api in
order to make sure the database is left in a consistent state.

bug 1088625
bug 1088627

Change-Id: I75f7dc188cc49e5f6e5c8a3cb256d1c42ff7d882
'}, {'created': '2012-12-13 14:18:23.000000000', 'message': "Fix poll_rescued_instances periodic task

The poll_rescued_instances periodic task now checks the amount of time
that an instance has been in the RESCUED stated before timing out the
rescue.  It also now performs the unrescue through the compute api in
order to make sure the database is left in a consistent state.

The poll_rescued_instances method is no longer necessary in the virt
driver interface and has been removed.  And also removed from the
different virt drivers, since it was just doing a 'pass' in each of
them.

bug 1088625
bug 1088627

Change-Id: I75f7dc188cc49e5f6e5c8a3cb256d1c42ff7d882
"}]
commit_message:
Fix poll_rescued_instances periodic task

The poll_rescued_instances periodic task now checks the amount of time
that an instance has been in the RESCUED stated before timing out the
rescue.  It also now performs the unrescue through the compute api in
order to make sure the database is left in a consistent state.

The poll_rescued_instances method is no longer necessary in the virt
driver interface and has been removed.  And also removed from the
different virt drivers, since it was just doing a 'pass' in each of
them.

bug 1088625
bug 1088627

Change-Id: I75f7dc188cc49e5f6e5c8a3cb256d1c42ff7d882

[{'created': '2012-12-12 22:45:25.000000000', 'message': 'Stop nbd leaks, remove pid race.

With the previous implementation, if a nbd device was found to be in
use by something other than nova it was removed from the class scoped
list of devices, but never re-added. This meant we "leaked" devices
away over time if we were competing with other nbd users on the
machine.

Instead of tracking our use at all, we should rely on the presence of
a user pid in /sys.

Resolves bug 1088083.

Change-Id: If777e270a0dda12034ea7ef1bc7fd688cadde8a9
'}, {'created': '2012-12-13 06:08:45.000000000', 'message': 'Stop nbd leaks, remove pid race.

With the previous implementation, if a nbd device was found to be in
use by something other than nova it was removed from the class scoped
list of devices, but never re-added. This meant we "leaked" devices
away over time if we were competing with other nbd users on the
machine.

Instead of tracking our use at all, we should rely on the presence of
a user pid in /sys.

Resolves bug 1088083.

Change-Id: If777e270a0dda12034ea7ef1bc7fd688cadde8a9
'}]
commit_message:
Stop nbd leaks, remove pid race.

With the previous implementation, if a nbd device was found to be in
use by something other than nova it was removed from the class scoped
list of devices, but never re-added. This meant we "leaked" devices
away over time if we were competing with other nbd users on the
machine.

Instead of tracking our use at all, we should rely on the presence of
a user pid in /sys.

Resolves bug 1088083.

Change-Id: If777e270a0dda12034ea7ef1bc7fd688cadde8a9

[{'created': '2012-12-13 19:54:13.000000000', 'message': "dhcp.filters needs ovs_vsctl permission

The dhcp agent calls ovs_vsctl so it will fail if using rootwrap
and these aren't specified. The reason why this was working using
rootwrap before is because there are other filters in
etc/quantum/rootwrap.d that specifiy ovs_vsctl which
allows the agent to make those calls. Fixes bug 1090072

Change-Id: I509c191c97e7187361a09788e841ebb5a9f934c7
"}]
commit_message:
dhcp.filters needs ovs_vsctl permission

The dhcp agent calls ovs_vsctl so it will fail if using rootwrap
and these aren't specified. The reason why this was working using
rootwrap before is because there are other filters in
etc/quantum/rootwrap.d that specifiy ovs_vsctl which
allows the agent to make those calls. Fixes bug 1090072

Change-Id: I509c191c97e7187361a09788e841ebb5a9f934c7

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-11 20:59:50.000000000', 'message': "Add VirtAPI tests

So far, VirtAPI has only been tested indirectly through the
other tests and modules that use it.

This adds a dedicated set of tests for the VirtAPI abstract class,
the virt/fake.py::FakeVirtAPI implementation, as well as the one
in compute/manager.py::ComputeVirtAPI. This test helps to ensure
that they all have the same method signatures and exhibit the
general behavior we expect. At the very least, this should help
them from getting out of sync in terms of their API. It also ensures
that methods can't be added to VirtAPI without a corresponding test.

Note the slight change in the FakeVirtAPI class to fix passing the
keyword arguments explicitly, which makes Mock happy.

Related (vaguely) to blueprint no-db-compute

Change-Id: Ib44379e17fae4df506b0108e20eb66b19195b1ca

commit_message:
Add VirtAPI tests

So far, VirtAPI has only been tested indirectly through the
other tests and modules that use it.

This adds a dedicated set of tests for the VirtAPI abstract class,
the virt/fake.py::FakeVirtAPI implementation, as well as the one
in compute/manager.py::ComputeVirtAPI. This test helps to ensure
that they all have the same method signatures and exhibit the
general behavior we expect. At the very least, this should help
them from getting out of sync in terms of their API. It also ensures
that methods can't be added to VirtAPI without a corresponding test.

Note the slight change in the FakeVirtAPI class to fix passing the
keyword arguments explicitly, which makes Mock happy.

Related (vaguely) to blueprint no-db-compute

Change-Id: Ib44379e17fae4df506b0108e20eb66b19195b1ca

[{'created': '2012-12-13 14:43:46.000000000', 'message': 'heat_keystoneclient ec2 user fix

Fix bug where we incorrectly use the request context user_id,
instead of the user_id associated with the resource calling
get_ec2_keypair()

commit_message:
heat_keystoneclient ec2 user fix

Fix bug where we incorrectly use the request context user_id,
instead of the user_id associated with the resource calling
get_ec2_keypair()

fixes bug 1089035

Change-Id: Ibb5e6d11461fb3ff1dd743066a9f7de3ee65b445
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
updating devstack element to reference incubator

devstack element points to github:tripleo/incubator, instead of demo.

Also, the element now pulls devstack into the image, rather than relying
on incubator/scripts/demo to pull it down after the image starts.

Change-Id: I878edcc8f5b1a509b14cadfb5fb4c33571a7f312

Fix github reference

Right now the devstack element is trying to pull tripleo/demo.git from
github, however, that repo has been renamed. Update the element
accordingly.

'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-08 14:41:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think it will lead to multiple server boot, instead of  single one. It might increase the total test time significantly.

If it is a refactor, Why I just see additions?'}, {'account_id': 4325, 'date': '2012-12-10 12:25:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

1) I don't understand the reason of such refactoring.

2) This patch adds code repetition. You can use setUp inside a class if you want to create a new server for test-case.

3) Have you considered using setupModule / setupPackage?

4) When using super(), be make sure all the parents (and their parents...) are using super(), otherwise you may run into problems that some classes  will not get initialized. https://fuhm.net/super-harmful/"}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-12-13 16:32:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

This is a necessary change. It will be more obvious when a more complete example is submitted. I'll resubmit this again as a complete example later this week"}]

commit_message:
Started refactor of server actions tests

* Broke down basic smoke action tests into classes
* Prepped fixtures drive data for the generic tests
* TODO: next patch will break the singe test method
  into each test class into distinct test methods

Change-Id: I6ab67d7b1947eadd62320034b80f43f6d8f5bba5

commit_message:
Don't skip watchrule test on exception

There are no circumstances in which failing to import the
heat.engine.watchrule module would not be an issue.

Change-Id: I6d03ed8f761a24aa69409010390289e387523813
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

in nova-client

commit_message:
Add nova client support for nova-manage agent command

This add four CLI (agent-list/agent-create/agent-delete/agent-modify)
in nova-client

so we can use:
'nova agent-list' like 'nova-manage agent list' with one optional
parameter. Show a list of all agent-builds. Filter by hypervisor.
The difference between the two commands is that 'nova agent-list'
will display the id of the agent build, 'nova-manage agent list'
will not.

'nova agent-create' like 'nova-manage agent create'. It will create
a agent build.

'nova agent-delete id' will delete the agent-build with specific id.

'nova agent-modfiy' will update the version, url, md5hash of the agent
build with specific id.

This patch depends on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/15831/
Implements one workitem of blueprint apis-for-nova-manage

Change-Id: Ic7589077d130efa5abc77252bd79addcaea483c8

commit_message:
Adds paramiko to pip-requires

The whitebox/SSH tests use paramiko, but it is not listed
in the tools/pip-requires. This adds it.

Change-Id: Icd3df69a94446f85772e515a820d8a013f0271f8
fixes: lp bug #1089763

commit_message:
Get rid of nose.main() in unit test files

This doesn't actually work and is not universally present, so get rid of
it. Tests are run through "nosetests", which does actually work.

Change-Id: Ib2d1e857e0aef4eab5fd75ffb1a498d8e9186c01
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2012-12-12 19:23:37.000000000', 'message': 'rebuild-for-ha core functionality

This implements blueprint rebuild-for-ha

Evacuation of VM from a failed host for HA.
New api supports recreate/rebuild modes. With shared storage,
VM is recreated on the target from disk.
Otherwise, rebuild from original image is performed.

* new evacuate method in compute.api
* new recreate flag in rpcapi.rebuild
* added functionality to clean evacuated instances on host init
* change in manager.rebuild to rebuild instance using existing disk

DocImpact

Change-Id: I670dc99d6f05deb6facdc8a240d94352d6316d6c

commit_message:
rebuild-for-ha core functionality

This implements blueprint rebuild-for-ha

Evacuation of VM from a failed host for HA.
New api supports recreate/rebuild modes. With shared storage,
VM is recreated on the target from disk.
Otherwise, rebuild from original image is performed.

* new evacuate method in compute.api
* new recreate flag in rpcapi.rebuild
* added functionality to clean evacuated instances on host init
* change in manager.rebuild to rebuild instance using existing disk

DocImpact

Change-Id: I670dc99d6f05deb6facdc8a240d94352d6316d6c
Co-authored-by: Oshrit Feder <oshritf@il.ibm.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-13 05:11:51.000000000', 'message': "Tempest should ignore SSL certificate validation

In testing and QA environments, often endpoints are set up
with self-signed or incomplete certs, and Tempest will bomb
out with complaints about being unable to validate SSL certificates.

Tempest isn't about testing SSL certificates. It's about testing
the OpenStack APIs, and if a common scenario is to test SSL and
endpoints in a testing environment, the client should disable
SSL cert checking.

Change-Id: I999cef9b5cd40a94c1b1bd63f4e19b2e58924c9a
fixes: lp bug #1089762
"}]
commit_message:
Tempest should ignore SSL certificate validation

In testing and QA environments, often endpoints are set up
with self-signed or incomplete certs, and Tempest will bomb
out with complaints about being unable to validate SSL certificates.

Tempest isn't about testing SSL certificates. It's about testing
the OpenStack APIs, and if a common scenario is to test SSL and
endpoints in a testing environment, the client should disable
SSL cert checking.

Change-Id: I999cef9b5cd40a94c1b1bd63f4e19b2e58924c9a
fixes: lp bug #1089762

format to other CFN API responses, by catching engine errors and mapping

commit_message:
heat cfn api, format waitcondition error responses correctly

Return errors from the waitcondition part of the CFN API in a similar
format to other CFN API responses, by catching engine errors and mapping
the error to an appropriate HeatAPIException.

fixes bug 1089032

Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I40486ed53fd4968519f623a3ea5a96f6c3374ea5

Fix for correctly parsing snapshot uuid in ec2api

* EC2 snapshot id correctly translated instead of volume uuid.
* Add unit tests changes for the existing test.

Fixes LP Bug #1089371

Provide some generic library that can be utilized by transformer.

commit_message:
Add CW publisher support.

CW requirs more changes other than the publisher, this is the basic
support to CW publisher, with disk IO metrics support.

Other metrics support requires more changes to other components, like
pollster etc, will be added one by one.

Provide some generic library that can be utilized by transformer.

Change-Id: Ie24bbadaf0f14eb64c0f5ebd010cfa5b37b735f3
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-04 06:24:44.000000000', 'message': 'The framework for multiple publisher

Add the multiple publisher framework support and provide meter publisher
as the only usage model now.

The pipeline manager is loaded as a driver plugin, in future, more plugin
manager can be provided, to meet different usage model.

Also rename ext_manager to pollster_manager or colloector_manager.

For bp: multi-publisher
Change-Id: If3b21cfb914d51152d963dd8e17ecd69c1001f04
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
The framework for multiple publisher

Add the multiple publisher framework support and provide meter publisher
as the only usage model now.

The pipeline manager is loaded as a driver plugin, in future, more plugin
manager can be provided, to meet different usage model.

Also rename ext_manager to pollster_manager or colloector_manager.

For bp: multi-publisher
Change-Id: If3b21cfb914d51152d963dd8e17ecd69c1001f04
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add support for parsing the <uuid> from libvirt host capabilities

The libvirt host capabilities provide a <uuid> element which
uniquely identifies the host platform.

Change-Id: Ic619a24b4b90c757b868aa78396d6cdee56ccb4b
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add support for libvirt domain <smbios> XML config

On x86 platforms the SMBIOS data tables can be customized
using the <smbios> XML config.

For example, to populate them based on the <sysinfo> data

            <smbios mode="sysinfo"/>

Or to copy the host's SMBIOS

            <smbios mode="host"/>

Change-Id: Ia4e6c1d9b0d66c58700ccf0f0fd97fa302aba64d
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use nova.test.TestCase as the base test class.

Subclass nova.test.TestCase instead of unittest.TestCase so that all
tests get the proper setUp and tearDown needed for all tests.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I8f3cd49e6e0e36eade1fd6ccb6c15359d38f2236

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-12 23:43:46.000000000', 'message': 'Makes the OS_NO_CACHE env variable work again

The commit to replace --os-no-cache with --os-no-cache works fine
with the cli options, but the env variable is stored in os_cache
which has the opposite of the intended effect. This patch converts
the variable to a bool and then inverts it before it stores it
in os_cache. This makes it work properly again.

Change-Id: Iea12806603ecdc39c6475ad4d6f867ebb1e01633
'}, {'created': '2012-12-12 23:59:36.000000000', 'message': 'Makes the OS_NO_CACHE env variable work again

The commit to replace --os-no-cache with --os-no-cache works fine
with the cli options, but the env variable is stored in os_cache
which has the opposite of the intended effect. This patch converts
the variable to a bool and then inverts it before it stores it
in os_cache. This makes it work properly again.

Fixes bug 1089696

Change-Id: Iea12806603ecdc39c6475ad4d6f867ebb1e01633
'}]
commit_message:
Makes the OS_NO_CACHE env variable work again

The commit to replace --os-no-cache with --os-no-cache works fine
with the cli options, but the env variable is stored in os_cache
which has the opposite of the intended effect. This patch converts
the variable to a bool and then inverts it before it stores it
in os_cache. This makes it work properly again.

Fixes bug 1089696

Change-Id: Iea12806603ecdc39c6475ad4d6f867ebb1e01633

commit_message:
Add support for libvirt domain <sysinfo> XML config

Libvirt domains can have system metadata defined in a <sysinfo>
XML element. For the x86 platform with KVM guests, this can then
be used to populate the SMBIOS data tables

            <sysinfo>
              <bios>
                <entry name="vendor">Acme</entry>
              </bios>
              <system>
                <entry name="manufacturer">Acme</entry>
                <entry name="product">Wile Coyote</entry>
                <entry name="uuid">c7a5fdbd-edaf-9455-926a-d65c16db1809</entry>
              </system>
            </sysinfo>

Change-Id: Ib4980ddc2f558921893a7e208e304ba59636e430
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make update_service_capabilities() accept a list of capabilities

This makes it possible to send multiple capabilites by single RPC.

Change-Id: I7c1b75eada17181c4fe08c55992b34d66276f498

Add arguments vg and lv for function check_size() so that locals() can get

Fixes: bug #1088434

Change-Id: I6b5609fe1be7e0bf09a45e65eab91427059a89db

commit_message:
Fix KeyError of log message in virt/libvirt/utils.py

Add arguments vg and lv for function check_size() so that locals() can get
them.

Fixes: bug #1088434

Change-Id: I6b5609fe1be7e0bf09a45e65eab91427059a89db

[{'created': '2012-12-11 19:11:06.000000000', 'message': "Move remaining aggregate operations to conductor

This patch moves the following aggregate operations from compute
to conductor:

  aggregate_get_by_host()
  aggregate_metadata_add()
  aggregate_metadata_delete()

In order to do that, it also changes the signature of the corresponding
VirtAPI methods to take the aggregate object instead of just the id,
so that we don't re-introduce any db messaging behavior.

I debated about using the set_delete mechanism in the metadata_add
API to avoid adding a separate conductor API for delete, but decided
that it wasn't worth the extra round trips, no matter how much I may
wish it were.

Change-Id: Ic0117879c8ce576cdc8e6c5af018bb918a15d4c0

commit_message:
Move remaining aggregate operations to conductor

This patch moves the following aggregate operations from compute
to conductor:

  aggregate_get_by_host()
  aggregate_metadata_add()
  aggregate_metadata_delete()

In order to do that, it also changes the signature of the corresponding
VirtAPI methods to take the aggregate object instead of just the id,
so that we don't re-introduce any db messaging behavior.

I debated about using the set_delete mechanism in the metadata_add
API to avoid adding a separate conductor API for delete, but decided
that it wasn't worth the extra round trips, no matter how much I may
wish it were.

Change-Id: Ic0117879c8ce576cdc8e6c5af018bb918a15d4c0

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-26 07:55:14.000000000', 'message': "Port to argparse based cfg

Import latest cfg from oslo-incubator with these changes:

 Improve cfg's argparse sub-parsers support
 Fix set_default() with boolean CLI options
 Fix regression with cfg CLI arguments
 Fix broken --help with CommonConfigOpts
 Hide the GroupAttr conf and group attributes
 Fix ListOpt to trim whitespace
 updating sphinx documentation
 Don't reference argparse._StoreAction
 Fix minor coding style issue
 Remove ConfigCliParser class
 Add support for positional arguments
 Use stock argparse behaviour for optional args
 Use stock argparse --usage behaviour
 Use stock argparse --version behaviour
 Remove add_option() method
 Completely remove cfg's disable_interspersed_args()
 argparse support for cfg

The main cfg API change is that CONF() no longer returns the un-parsed
CLI arguments. To handle these args, you need to use the support for
positional arguments or sub-parsers.

Switching nova-manage to use sub-parser based CLI arguments means the
following changes in behaviour:

 - no more lazy matching of commands - e.g. 'nova-manage proj q' will
   no longer work. If we find out about common abbreviations used in
   peoples' scripts, we can easily add those.

 - the help output displayed if you run nova-manage without any args
   (or just a category) has changed

 - 'nova-manage version list' is no longer equivalent to
   'nova-manage version'

Change-Id: I19ef3a1c00e97af64d199e27cb1cdc5c63b46a82

commit_message:
Port to argparse based cfg

Import latest cfg from oslo-incubator with these changes:

 Add deprecated --logdir common opt
 Add deprecated --logfile common opt.
 Allow nova and others to override some logging defaults
 Fixing the trim for ListOp when reading from config file
 Fix set_default() with boolean CLI options
 Improve cfg's argparse sub-parsers support
 Hide the GroupAttr conf and group attributes
 Fix regression with cfg CLI arguments
 Fix broken --help with CommonConfigOpts
 Fix ListOpt to trim whitespace
 updating sphinx documentation
 Don't reference argparse._StoreAction
 Fix minor coding style issue
 Remove ConfigCliParser class
 Add support for positional arguments
 Use stock argparse behaviour for optional args
 Use stock argparse --usage behaviour
 Use stock argparse --version behaviour
 Remove add_option() method
 Completely remove cfg's disable_interspersed_args()
 argparse support for cfg

The main cfg API change is that CONF() no longer returns the un-parsed
CLI arguments. To handle these args, you need to use the support for
positional arguments or sub-parsers.

Switching nova-manage to use sub-parser based CLI arguments means the
following changes in behaviour:

 - no more lazy matching of commands - e.g. 'nova-manage proj q' will
   no longer work. If we find out about common abbreviations used in
   peoples' scripts, we can easily add those.

 - the help output displayed if you run nova-manage without any args
   (or just a category) has changed

 - 'nova-manage version list' is no longer equivalent to
   'nova-manage version'

Change-Id: I19ef3a1c00e97af64d199e27cb1cdc5c63b46a82

commit_message:
Remove unused bridge interfaces

If a network gateway of multi hosted network is unsed by any VM on the
host, we tear down it.
It is implemented only with the VLAN manager.

Fixes LP bug #1084651

Change-Id: Ia7e399de5b8ddf6ec252d38dfbb8762c4f14e3a5

commit_message:
Checks guest status during migration.

During a migration, waits two minutes, checking the guest status to
make sure mysql and the guest are successfully restarted, and if not,
revert the failed migration.

Implements: blueprint migration-check-guest-status
Change-Id: I1d13815ef211b6c19c5860d3e4b847bdf80cc7e3

commit_message:
Checks guest status during migration.

During a migration, waits two minutes, checking the guest status to
make sure mysql and the guest are successfully restarted, and if not,
revert the failed migration.

Implements: bluebrint migration-check-guest-status
Change-Id: If1f980d257cd835ec8bc85c2d5907ee54a5903ee

Allow rpc-silent FloatingIP exceptions in n-net

This patch uses the new client_exceptions functionality to squelch
some errant exception dumps in the RPC layer.

Fixes bug 1084707

I'm more than happy to strip out the network ones from this patch and follow up with another patch to do that, and the exhaustive sweep of the rest in network/manager.py."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-12-11 13:56:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Dan - my bad, sorry. You're right, given the solution we should treat these as separate bugs

So, let's deal with the network manager issues separately

I guess there are two ways of approaching this a) go through the network manager code and, for each method, figure out which exceptions could be the fault of the caller rather than the network service or b) do nothing until we have a concrete report of an exception being thrown during normal operation and then add just that exception for the method which threw it

In your network manager patch, it more seemed like we have a report of FloatingIpNotFound being thrown from get_floating_ip() so we added that to all methods .... which seems odd to me"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-12-11 14:44:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Okay, I'll strip the network bits out of this one and resubmit. I do think that applying the exclusions as we encounter them is the way to go.

Looking closer at the network stuff, I was clearly a little overzealous with the application of the FloatingIpNotFound exclusions. I was looking for methods that did any sort of floating_ip_get operation, and thought I remember convincing myself that it was the right thing to do, but looking back now, I'm sure some of those are wrong :)

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-12-11 16:47:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-12-11 16:54:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2012-12-11 16:54:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-03 21:06:38.000000000', 'message': "Allow exceptions to pass over RPC silently

When one service performs an operation on behalf of another, the
act of passing back an exception (even a known one) causes a lot
of scary log messages about the (presumed to be) error case. This
patch adds a client_exceptions decorator common/rpc/common.py,
which allows RPC services to declare the list of expected exceptions
for each method. If such an exception is raised during the RPC
dispatch, it is wrapped in a ClientException so that the RPC layer
can gracefully pass it back without overly-verbose logging.

This patch applies this decorator to conductor's methods, but the
technique may be used elsewhere.

Fixes bug 1084707

commit_message:
Allow conductor exceptions to pass over RPC silently

When one service performs an operation on behalf of another, the
act of passing back an exception (even a known one) causes a lot
of scary log messages about the (presumed to be) error case.

This patch applies the new client_exceptions decorator to methods
in the conductor manager to prevent excess logging for known
situations.

Fixes bug 1084706

Change-Id: I56e472b0f08d584f5bbe5181ca909f2c11352120

commit_message:
Fixes lib/heat to use DATABASE_PASSWORD instead of MYSQL_PASSWORD

The latter is not used anywhere else, but the former is used in all
of the other projects sharing the mysql database for devstack.

Change-Id: I2a0cd7e5b908eb144468caf410a6c41e0e5e3fd0

commit_message:
Use admin user to read Quantum port.

This is part of blueprint vif-plugging-improvements.

The port vif_type is only returned from Quantum when the user
is an admin user.

This patch ensures that when Nova reads the ports the user is an
admin user.

Change-Id: I4d1a2bfc6e3ae4ad63fe5c72eda32137713b31c6

commit_message:
Add vif_type to the VIF model

This is part of blueprint vif-plugging-improvements.

The patch has two parts:
1. Add support for vif_type to the VIF model
2. Read the vif_type from the Quantum port binding

The patch is backward compatible, that is, a quantum plugin
does not need to return the vif_type.

Change-Id: Ice772f00b22163da98b98a2c69a0a4ad3f5526ff

commit_message:
Add TLS support for keystone via proxy

* Adds lib/tls to create test CA/certs
* Start proxy if 'tls-proxy' is enabled
* Configure keystone service catalog for TLS
* Tear down proxy in unstack.sh
* Set auth protocol and ca-cert chain in openrc
* Add DATA_DIR to stackrc

This is the first in a series of patches to enable TLS support
for the service API endpoints.

Change-Id: Ia1c91dc8f1aaf94fbec9dc71da322559a83d14b6

commit_message:
Fix postgresql setup on openSUSE

The initdb call is part of starting the service for the first time, so
we need to do that.

Also, restart postgresql after sed'ing its configuration files: if it
was already running for some reason, it needs to be restarted, not
started.

Change-Id: Ib7d3ff5217d06a7764a62a36084090514a1825ea

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-06 09:25:57.000000000', 'message': "Fix polkit configuration to allow usage of libvirt on openSUSE

There is a buggy limitation with pkla files on openSUSE, that blocks
using 'unix-group:libvirtd' from working. A pkla with such a matching
identity will be overruled by the pkla generated by polkit-default-privs
containing 'unix-group:*' (which will match the other groups the user
belongs to, likely after matching libvirtd).

To work around this, explicitly allow the user instead.

Also, move the creation of the libvirtd group a bit later, to clarify
the code.

Change-Id: Ia3e4ae982accfc247a744eaa6d6aa4935e4f404c
"}, {'created': '2012-12-12 15:15:48.000000000', 'message': "Fix polkit configuration to allow usage of libvirt on openSUSE

There is a buggy limitation with pkla files on openSUSE, that blocks
using 'unix-group:libvirtd' from working. A pkla with such a matching
identity will be overruled by the pkla generated by polkit-default-privs
containing 'unix-group:*' (which will match the other groups the user
belongs to, likely after matching libvirtd).

To work around this, explicitly allow the user instead.

Also, move the creation of the libvirtd group a bit later, to clarify
the code.

Change-Id: Ia3e4ae982accfc247a744eaa6d6aa4935e4f404c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix polkit configuration to allow usage of libvirt on openSUSE

There is a buggy limitation with pkla files on openSUSE, that blocks
using 'unix-group:libvirtd' from working. A pkla with such a matching
identity will be overruled by the pkla generated by polkit-default-privs
containing 'unix-group:*' (which will match the other groups the user
belongs to, likely after matching libvirtd).

To work around this, explicitly allow the user instead.

Also, move the creation of the libvirtd group a bit later, to clarify
the code.

Change-Id: Ia3e4ae982accfc247a744eaa6d6aa4935e4f404c

commit_message:
Fix argument checking method for 'nova list --flavor' command.

According to Vish's comment for patchese 1, flavor-id is uuid/int
and it is a problem that uuid cannot be specified in 'nova list --flavor'.
This patch fixes the problem.

Fixes bug 1076818

Change-Id: I7d216efb59c7f567067ca19b695c7f93de009bd6

[{'created': '2012-12-12 02:44:34.000000000', 'message': "Bump required lxml version to >=3.0.1

The current requirement of >=2.3.5 is insufficient because we have tests which
rely on element attributes being alphabetized which doesn't occur in 2.3.5.
>=3.0.1 does alphabetize the attributes.

Side-note: the practice of relying on element attribute order is highly
dubious since alphabetization is a courtesy provided by lxml and not something
inherent to the XML standard. Long term, we should rework our tests to avoid
this practice entirely.

Fixes bug 1089192

Change-Id: Ibc7ada29cb026b278e2c35465e9ff8a36704e122
"}]
commit_message:
Bump required lxml version to >=3.0.1

The current requirement of >=2.3.5 is insufficient because we have tests which
rely on element attributes being alphabetized which doesn't occur in 2.3.5.
>=3.0.1 does alphabetize the attributes.

Side-note: the practice of relying on element attribute order is highly
dubious since alphabetization is a courtesy provided by lxml and not something
inherent to the XML standard. Long term, we should rework our tests to avoid
this practice entirely.

Fixes bug 1089192

Change-Id: Ibc7ada29cb026b278e2c35465e9ff8a36704e122

[{'created': '2012-12-11 23:34:54.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid infinite recursion in swift.obj.replicator.get_hashes.

Fixes bug 1089140.

Turns out that if an exception bails out of the pickle loading (eg.
zero-byte hahes_file), the if clause to determine whether or not to
write out a fresh hashes_file can evaluate to false, leading to an
infinite loop.

This patch fixes this infinite loop generally, by ensuring that if any
exception is thrown, a new hashes_file is written.

Change-Id: I344c5f8e261ce7c667bdafe1687263a4150b21dc
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid infinite recursion in swift.obj.replicator.get_hashes.

Fixes bug 1089140.

Turns out that if an exception bails out of the pickle loading (eg.
zero-byte hahes_file), the if clause to determine whether or not to
write out a fresh hashes_file can evaluate to false, leading to an
infinite loop.

This patch fixes this infinite loop generally, by ensuring that if any
exception is thrown, a new hashes_file is written.

Change-Id: I344c5f8e261ce7c667bdafe1687263a4150b21dc

commit_message:
Add a service_check function

There is no function to check if the services invoked by devstack are
running well or not. We could use the function to check their status
and print them at the end of devstack running.

Change-Id: I845f6b5dddce5cffa7165ec58517f9ae5d8632a6

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-11 09:16:30.000000000', 'message': 'Always create signing_dir regardless of token format

Fixes bug 1088801

devstack does not create signing_dir when keystone token format is UUID.
If the default value of signing_dir is read-only, OpenStack services
such as Quantum server failed to start due to permission denied.

On the keystone client cannot know which token_format is used in keystone
in advance, so signing_dir should be created regardless of the token format.

Change-Id: I1b0d25c1ac4d22d9fb2c5443d15b96fdaa5a4c81
'}]
commit_message:
Always create signing_dir regardless of token format

Fixes bug 1088801

devstack does not create signing_dir when keystone token format is UUID.
If the default value of signing_dir is read-only, OpenStack services
such as Quantum server failed to start due to permission denied.

On the keystone client cannot know which token_format is used in keystone
in advance, so signing_dir should be created regardless of the token format.

Change-Id: I1b0d25c1ac4d22d9fb2c5443d15b96fdaa5a4c81

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-12 07:18:04.000000000', 'message': "Properly scope password options

enable_instance_password is only used in api.openstack.compute.servers
so move it there.

password_length is passed as a parameter to every generate_password()
call, so just move it into nova.utils and have generate_password()
use it by default.

Note: using a config option as the default value of a kwarg isn't a
good idea because the option value is read when the function is defined
which means you can't control its value during unit tests. Instead we
use password=None as the default.

blueprint: scope-config-opts
Change-Id: I445174515fc2eacc56c7cccecadadd2a7e57d4f4
"}, {'created': '2012-12-12 08:29:54.000000000', 'message': "Properly scope password options

enable_instance_password is only used in api.openstack.compute.servers
so move it there.

password_length is passed as a parameter to every generate_password()
call, so just move it into nova.utils and have generate_password()
use it by default.

Note: using a config option as the default value of a kwarg isn't a
good idea because the option value is read when the function is defined
which means you can't control its value during unit tests. Instead we
use password=None as the default.

blueprint: scope-config-opts
Change-Id: I445174515fc2eacc56c7cccecadadd2a7e57d4f4
"}]
commit_message:
Properly scope password options

enable_instance_password is only used in api.openstack.compute.servers
so move it there.

password_length is passed as a parameter to every generate_password()
call, so just move it into nova.utils and have generate_password()
use it by default.

Note: using a config option as the default value of a kwarg isn't a
good idea because the option value is read when the function is defined
which means you can't control its value during unit tests. Instead we
use password=None as the default.

blueprint: scope-config-opts
Change-Id: I445174515fc2eacc56c7cccecadadd2a7e57d4f4

commit_message:
Changing display_name to name in v2 api

This allows the v2 api responses to be more consistent with other
projects. This approach is making the idea compatible in v2, rather
than changing the model.

blueprint name-attr-consistency

Change-Id: I74e46b4204353d5712be788fe2138784b2a72305

commit_message:
Ensure datetimes can be properly serialized.

The nova-network manager was returning db models from methods invoked
via rpc.call().  These db models include non-primitive types that can
not be properly serialized (namely datetime objects).  Use
to_primitive() to ensure that the data gets serialized properly.

Fix bug 1089430.

Change-Id: I019504cf68b2d420437c550b596eda8a12fe6618

commit_message:
Improve pep8 checks to be similar to those in nova

This adds hacking.py, based on the one in nova, to wrap around
pep8 and enforce more stringent checks on tempest. This adds
the rules that nova is currently enforcing on incoming commits.

The rules that pep8 is ignoring are copied from the pep8 check on
jenkins.

The HACKING file was also updated to indicate the inclusion
of the new rules that are being enforced.

Change-Id: I5c85829ee15d4264d8de2d9f0207d9dd3dfbbff2

'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2012-12-12 16:59:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

This is a step backwards in the sense that the operator will no longer be able to override which Resource subclass provides the instances by adding a plugin with a different implementation of AWS::EC2::Instance.

There are a number of options:
- Just define the class inline - classes can be defined in any scope.
- Create a Mix-in class with just that method and then programmatically create a subclass with multiple inheritance.
- Monkey-patch the method into the object after it has been created.

The first is probably the simplest."}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2012-12-12 17:19:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2012-12-12 17:21:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-12 17:28:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Override events for AutoScalingGroup instances

Override state-transition events by subclassing the Instance
resource to AutoScalingGroupInstance, this avoids problems where
events can't lookup the resource via parser.Stack (since these
resources aren't "real" resources defined in the template)

fixes bug 1089338

Change-Id: Ia064cd067eefdaa5ca81b0cb822ce2fa443bac85
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
resource state_set, abstract update/store logic

Abstract the DB update/store logic so the state_set function
can be more cleanly overridden for AutoScalingGroupInstance

ref bug 1089338

Change-Id: I02dc52068feaeed8ec8210269d9abb7b124f0a19
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

enable tempest by default

turn on tempest by default, as that will provide the end users
with a testing environment to use with openstack out of the box.

[{'created': '2012-12-11 20:37:07.000000000', 'message': 'Implement an XML matcher

Uses the "Matcher" interface of the testtools assertThat() call to
compare XML document strings safely.  This will result in more
useful error results and will ignore attribute ordering issues
that caused problems with tests affected by lxml version skew.

Also converts test_libvirt_config to use XMLMatches, to
demonstrate its use.

Change-Id: I7821557a73eb8b5aca823cfccd02b4b660e0ffdb
'}]
commit_message:
Implement an XML matcher

Uses the "Matcher" interface of the testtools assertThat() call to
compare XML document strings safely.  This will result in more
useful error results and will ignore attribute ordering issues
that caused problems with tests affected by lxml version skew.

Also converts test_libvirt_config to use XMLMatches, to
demonstrate its use.

Change-Id: I7821557a73eb8b5aca823cfccd02b4b660e0ffdb

commit_message:
Autodetect nbd devices.

This means we don't need to the max_nbd_devices flag any more at all.
This patch also moves the internal representation of the list of
available nbd devices to not including the leading /dev/, but that is
not exposed as a change in the interface to the class.

Resolves bug 861504 and its duplicate 1088339.

DocImpact.

Change-Id: I5c6218122ab09781d8a2ecd6d8b76a74be4a6e91

It is not just style change. It catches Exception instead of BaseException (All exception), However it is not bad behavior in the viewed  cases, but it should be mentioned in commit message.

I think you should fix the inline issue, in the same commit.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2012-12-10 15:23:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

There are a lot of places where the except logic could use a lot of improvement. In my mind just having 'except' or 'except Exception' is not the correct way. But, I just did this as a quick clean-up to fix the pep8 failures and didn't delve to deeply into this.

I think that the best way to handle this is to go in and do a real clean up of all the excepts in tempest as another patch series."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-10 15:58:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

You are correct the issue is more serious. The expect removal would not be bad idea in many cases.
But we should distinguish FAIL and ERROR cases. I wonder wouldn't be better if the rest client rewarded the error (4xx and maybe the 5xx) responses with a "FAIL type" exception.

The cleanup (teardwon) logic should be improved as well.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-12-12 14:14:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Approved

I'm not quite sure what you mean by FAIL vs ERROR. Perhaps filing a bug ticket would clarify the issue."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-12 14:23:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

commit_message:
Don't allow identifiers with slashes

Ensure that creating an Identifier with a slash in either the stack name or
the resource name results in an immediate exception.

Change-Id: I79121a26009b5b7b3eee994f98ba802b239f5f12
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-12 14:58:52.000000000', 'message': "Don't allow slashes in Stack or Resource names

There is no way for the ReST API to handle Stack or Resource names that
contain slashes since WSGI decodes the path before passing it to the
application, such that even correctly url-encoded slashes are
indistinguishable from path separators. Therefore, prohibit slashes in
Stack and Resource names.

bug 1088928

Change-Id: Ie6fa5a1bc7b5ae7054300419644008c5cc42187e
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Don't allow slashes in Stack or Resource names

There is no way for the ReST API to handle Stack or Resource names that
contain slashes since WSGI decodes the path before passing it to the
application, such that even correctly url-encoded slashes are
indistinguishable from path separators. Therefore, prohibit slashes in
Stack and Resource names.

bug 1088928

Change-Id: Ie6fa5a1bc7b5ae7054300419644008c5cc42187e
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

As I heard, now OpenStack generally accepts all request and just latter ERRORs the status.

Erroring the second attempt, does not looks bad behavior.

The issue could be caused by config or API change, we might accept the ERROR status for the second one as expected behavior. But first we need to know is it planned change or  not. commit_message:
Properly scope isolated hosts config opts

The isolated_hosts and isolated_images options are only used by the
isolated hosts scheduler filter, so move them there.

commit_message:
Move monkey patch config opts into nova.utils

The monkey_patch and monkey_patch_modules configuration options are
only used in nova.utils, so move them there.

commit_message:
Transifex-ify ceilometer.

Following http://wiki.openstack.org/Translations to integrate transifex
translation into ceilometer.

This is part of the fixing of the bug 1082805.

We added an empty ceiloemter/locale/ceilometer.pot file to avoid the
failure of the Jenkin's translation-jobs because git doesn't allow empty
directory to be added into the repository.

We still need to do the following things once this patch gets accepted:

1. Create a ceilometer project and related resources on transifex, and
make sure it's part of the openstack project hub.

2. Give access of transifex ceilometer project to the openstack jenkins
account.

3. Added the translation-jobs into openstack/openstack-ci-puppet for
ceilometer.

Change-Id: Ic6ea3646401440027fe3fcd2db235c0ca6c5831d

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-22 02:03:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix use_single_default_gateway

With FlatDHCP and use_single_default_gateway nova-network creates
an invalid entry in the dnsmasq .opts file for the network that
contains a blank router option.  New instances will not receive
a default gateway.

Change-Id: I4c2da61def0681b7b253ae387bf83c069484e28b
Fixes: bug #1075859
(cherry picked from commit 1b455923446de6fcfee7166059db72b80ff51dfe)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix use_single_default_gateway

With FlatDHCP and use_single_default_gateway nova-network creates
an invalid entry in the dnsmasq .opts file for the network that
contains a blank router option.  New instances will not receive
a default gateway.

Change-Id: I4c2da61def0681b7b253ae387bf83c069484e28b
Fixes: bug #1075859
(cherry picked from commit 1b455923446de6fcfee7166059db72b80ff51dfe)

commit_message:
Use testtools as the base testcase class.

As a step towards parallelizing the test runs, use testtools as the
base unittest test case class. In this patch, it has caused us to catch
places where setUp and tearDown were not being chained properly.
Additionally, we get to remove our custom skip decorators and a few
backported assert calls.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: Ia2025e1b7191b65130b85b30ce6239d5c431c8ba

(1 inline comment)

I am not a fan of this optimisation:
 * It adds further (unnecessary IMO) complexity to the Stack.load() API
 * The original Heat code had big problems with hidden state that you had to keep track of in your head. We've almost gotten rid of it; this is a step in the wrong direction.
 * It only optimises one case
 * It breaks an existing, working, externally-defined API

Let's get rid of the whole Template table from the database and make it a column in the Stack table. There is no earthly reason for them to be separate. Fixing that makes _everything_ fast without breaking the cfn API."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2012-12-11 16:07:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

A stack may be deleted between querying the stacks to list and formatting
each stack.

This issue was found by concurrently creating and deleting 100 stacks
while running heat list.

This change avoids any further database calls for each stack by
passing in an empty template.  This means that for list_stacks we currently
don't have access to the template description, but this could always be
stored in a dedicated db column.

Running create, list, delete concurrently 100 times takes 89 seconds without
this change, 64 seconds with it.

Change-Id: I4a47bbdbde111454672c2579caf28b4675c3cf10

passing in an empty template.  This means that for list_stacks we currently
don't have access to the template description, but this could always be
stored in a dedicated db column.

Running create, list, delete concurrently 100 times takes 89 seconds without
this change, 64 seconds with it.

Change-Id: I4a47bbdbde111454672c2579caf28b4675c3cf10
