commit_message:
Fix race condition in list_stacks

A stack may be deleted between querying the stacks to list and formatting
each stack.

This issue was found by concurrently creating and deleting 100 stacks
while running heat list.

Change-Id: I4a47bbdbde111454672c2579caf28b4675c3cf10

commit_message:
wsgi.Middleware forward-compatibility with webob 1.2b1 or later

Response.request is None by default
(http://docs.webob.org/en/latest/news.html#b1), but is used in the
CacheFilter WSGI middleware.

Fixes bug 1045179

Change-Id: I28f5ca92fe517f4f56af934799db32650e079ba7

commit_message:
Move some options into nova.image.glance

The glance_api_servers and glance_api_insecure options are only used in
nova.image.glance. The only other place that glance_num_retries is used
is nova.virt.xenapi.vm_utils.

blueprint: scope-config-opts
Change-Id: I2cd0f62e43379bc94c95f85ab5b4aac9faf6c4f7

commit_message:
Move cache_images to nova.virt.xenapi.vm_utils

While the cache_images option sounds hypervisor agnostic, it is actually
xenapi specific. Move it into the xenapi driver makes this much more
clear.

blueprint: scope-config-opts
Change-Id: I5c86159f638fc30ee0158a249c91cf29d46cdbb5

commit_message:
Move api_rate_limit and auth_strategy to nova.api

api_rate_limit is only used in nova.api.auth and auth_strategy is only used in
one other place. Scoping both options to nova.api.auth makes their purpose more
clear.

blueprint: scope-config-opts
Change-Id: I03f35c0e38239ecd96e8c304527530d42ab4097e

commit_message:
Cleanup the test DNS managers.

There is a fair amount of indirection in place here, which could be
trimmed - this patch takes a minimal approach and only causes the
current top level entry to be called, fixing bug 1088761.

Change-Id: Ifd80f99561eb95257f2a1bf45a39f678a2c1f59c

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-12-04 18:39:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

One question inline where you might have missed something"}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-12-04 18:42:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-12-04 18:48:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-12-05 17:40:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

(13 inline comments)

This patch removes a lot of the 'else' clauses for the distro tests leading to silent failures.  One of the distros should be chosen as the default or an else clause added throwing an appropriate error."}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-12-06 09:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-12-06 09:18:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the review, that's a good point. I've added a new exit_distro_not_supported function that we can use in else statements. I feel that it's the cleanest approach."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-06 09:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/17491/2/check/gate-devstack-merge/2046 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17491/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/21257 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-12-06 13:59:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I'm still unsure how I feel about the exit. I think if we're going to do that, we should do it just once, very early in stack.sh, and be done with it.

However there is a specific issue flagged inline that should be fixed."}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-12-06 14:28:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

(replied to the inline comment)

re the exit: we actually already do that with the check for FORCE=yes. The idea behind doing exit everywhere else, with a nice message, is to make it easier to port to another distro (just run, wait for an issue, fix, run again, etc.). I think it's a bit better better than just defaulting to the behavior of one distro and assume it will work.

That being said, I don't care that much about this. I'm happy to do whatever you feel is better."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-12-06 20:32:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

If we are going to specifically call out each distro in these checks then the else clause should fall through (or be absent) if it remains a valid configuration otherwise issue a useful message and stop.

This is a change from how devstack was built: mostly only testing for exceptions and defaulting to the general case.  It is also part of the reason it took a good bit of lobbying to get fedora supported in the first place as now we're well on the way to having bits of the code look like pre-autoconf portable C code."}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-12-07 07:47:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-12-07 07:58:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-12-07 08:06:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-07 08:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Add is_fedora and exit_distro_not_supported functions

Between is_fedora, is_ubuntu and is_suse, we can make the code a bit
simpler to read. We also use exit_distro_not_supported to identify
places where we need implementation details for new distros.

As "/sbin/service --skip-redirect" is Fedora-specific, guard this with a
is_fedora test too.

Change-Id: Ic77c0697ed9be0dbb5df8e73da93463e76025f0c

commit_message:
Support --os-cacert

* Rename --ca-file to --os-cacert (--ca-file deprecated for
  backward compatibility)
* Add cacert to keystoneclient initialization to verify the
  keystone server certificate

This aligns glanceclient with keystoneclient for option naming
and the use of TLS for the keystone auth connection.  It does not
change the use of TLS/SSL for the glance connection.

Change-Id: If8b05655aea5f3c62612d77bf947dd790f77eddf

commit_message:
fix intermittent failures with deferred version test

Found a better mechanism to hook into the argparse's
for better control over the version printing mechanism
the problem was overriding string methods is hard and
flaky. it's better to use hooks in argparse to implement
the delayed lazy load of version information. Added a
test to try longer string and even run it in a loop.

Fixes LP #1087575

Change-Id: Ic510d67182d4f781856f2b1c1be0afbe9e28c7e1

commit_message:
Set instance_ref['node'] in _set_instance_host_and_node

instance_ref is finally passed to ComputeDriver.spawn().
The instance_ref['node'] must be set before spawn() is called
since a ComputeDriver managing multiple nodes may use the value
in spawn(). Without this patch, _set_instance_host_and_node()
updates only 'host' and 'launched_on' in instance_ref although
it updates 'host', 'launched_on' and 'node' in DB.
It is natural and necessary that we set instance_ref['node'] there.

blueprint general-bare-metal-provisioning-framework

Change-Id: I5cdf7d9a9d59d30a9e2f1d15c9ec74428828570c
